channel.title: team on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in team on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Weekly Digest #15: New year Gathering: Sharing Tết, starting strong
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We kicked off our gathering after Tết, bringing the community back together in true Dwarves style - dropping some SOL and ICY tokens into everyone’s wallets, bringing the community back together in true Dwarves style.

item.title: 2024 In Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Summit 2024: Building bonds our way
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The journey begins Penang’s vibrant streets became our playground this year. Our goal stood clear and simple: reconnect, recharge, and create memories together.

item.title: Weekly Digest #14: Embracing hybrid work - the best of both worlds
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Since the start, Dwarves has valued flexibility, allowing our team to work where inspiration strikes. But there’s something special about being together—learning, sharing knowledge, and working side by side.

item.title: The Stage of AI and LLM at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hello, It’s Han & Nikki here. We have been quite busy with setting up our knowledge system to ensure learning is the top priority for everyone in the team, not just for the management.

item.title: Record and reward sharing at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Record & reward sharing at Dwarves If you’re part of the Dwarves community, you’ll notice our culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.

item.title: Weekly Digest #13: More than lines of code
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome to this week’s edition of our roundup, where we highlight the moments that make us more than just lines of code.

item.title: Weekly Digest #12: Summer moments - Our team's remote work adventures
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: You know, there’s something magical about bringing people together around what they love. It might seem simple, but a lot of thought goes into it.

item.title: State of Dwarves: 2024 Semi-annual Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In the past six months, we’ve made some pretty impressive strides in testing new standards and adding more automation, activities, and rewards to our Discord server to foster a supportive community among tech lovers.

item.title: Weekly Digest #9: A little more speed for summer
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: How quickly the first half of the year speeds up before it slows down. It’s really the second half of 2024 already.

item.title: Weekly Digest #8: Then came the last days of May
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Here’s to hoping for a brighter and better month on this last day of May. We’re in the heat of a community offline meet-up today, gathering to discuss the month’s progress.

item.title: Weekly Digest #7: A journey through time
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The sun peeks over the horizon, Saturday vibes and good news – the perfect combo. We’re about to spice up your weekend with a recap of all the awesome things we whipped up this week.

item.title: Weekly Digest #6: Come for the conversation, stay for the culture
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hi, it’s @innno_ again. Summer is almost here. But don’t worry, this update is all about making your day more comfortable.

item.title: Weekly Digest #5: Endure the hardship, delay the gratification
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Greetings from Saigon, I’m here again, bringing you a lot of updates. There are big and small things brewing at Dwarves network.

item.title: Weekly Digest #4: Finding your authentic tribe
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome back to the #4 weekly digest after a long holiday. Those Discord channels are still buzzing with active messages. Without further ado, let’s see what I’ve got to share.

item.title: Culture Handbook
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Towards growth Keep learning and growing. We started this team out of software practice advancement. The continuous study lays the foundation for the future growth.

item.title: How we hire
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hiring means we need help. We only hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around. We always look for long-term teammates that why we want to ensure the new hire is a value fit and culture fit.

item.title: How we work
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We do Agile We build software. The way we see it is a collaboration between multiple people in the team with sufficient knowledge on the domain and clearly understand the project vision that they can quickly adapt to the changes in the market.

item.title: Making a career
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The average tenure of employees working at many technology companies today is shockingly low. At both Amazon, Google and other companies, it’s just around one year.

item.title: What we stand for
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Empower Innovation with Software Craftsmanship Innovation happens. There are many startups found and raise fund every day. They focus on making significant positive changes, impact millions of people, lead to breakthroughs and support the foundation of economic growth.

item.title: What we value
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before anything else, values come first. The value is important to us. They are what we proud of. They help guide us when we are facing a difficult decision.

item.title: Where we work
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Office The Dwarves HQ is in Saigon, Vietnam. Thirty people and two cats have desk space in the Saigon office, but those people also work from home regularly.

item.title: Life at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re like-minded teammates who pursue ambitious goals with tech culture and codes of conduct. Build a place we love to work at We build this company like we build a product.

item.title: 2022 In Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Successfully went through 2022, a year that we might say - a new record: team reached highest growth record, kickstarted community engagement, home, compliance training & individual development are speeding up, and a whole new place to call Dwarves.

item.title: Dwarves Of The Year 2022
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It’s been a long journey, but we’ve finally made it to 2022 and what a year it’s been for our team of Dwarves.

item.title: The Inner Circle
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The concept of an “inner circle” within a company is not a new one, and at Dwarves, a software company founded by a group of engineers, this idea holds a significant value.

item.title: Summit 2022: Engineering A Good Time
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We don’t treat team bonding the common way because we understand our engineers. Most of our engineers don’t want to run and get sweaty on the beach for “team-building” activities, or pretend to smile in front of the travel agent’s camera.

item.title: Configure The Company Email
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Make sure you have 2FA enabled For this method to work, you need to have two factor authentification enabled for your Google account.

item.title: Passing The Probation Get 3 Upvotes
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The talent pool Dwarves are backed by the talent pool. We’re selective for those that are in the funnel. Like-minded people and their unique values stay above everything.

item.title: Road To 100
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: 2022 matched us with the 80th Dwarves. A notable highlight, and we’re ready to have more. It’s not easy to find people that has the same value.

item.title: The Next Leading Chairs
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Our vision for growth Last Jan 2020, we got the chance to celebrate our first milestone - Dwarves Foundation reached 5 years old.

item.title: The future is blockchain and data
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It’s Han and Nikki here, Plus an extra fresh voice we’re bringing to Dwarves Updates, in hope we can offer you more engineering-related insights and thoughts.

item.title: Benefits And Perks
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Since the majority of Dwarves Foundation employees work in Saigon, this section is written with that as the default. Some benefits don’t make sense in other countries.

item.title: It's a wrap: 2021 in Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hey, it’s Han and Nikki in your inbox again. On behalf of the entire Dwarves team, happy 2022! For us 2021 is eventful, and memorable.

item.title: Dwarves Radio Talk 17 Conduct A 1 1 Session
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In this Radio Talk, Thanh Pham - our Head of Web, shared how he conducts a 1-1 meeting with the Fellows.

item.title: Dwarves Radio Talk 16 Run An Effective Performance Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Performance Review We perform bi-yearly reviews in July and January. The primary purpose of these reviews is to **give feedback **on career path advancement and recognize accomplishments.

item.title: What's New in July 2021
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re closing July with some notable highlights. Let’s go through them. 🚨 Note: Covid situation is getting worse. Stay safe. 🦠

item.title: Making Decision As A Team Member
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Democracy in a Nutshell Sure we all heard of democracy. Mostly, this term appears in erhm, election? However, from what I understand, democracy is maintained by giving decision-making power to the people.

item.title: The Adjacent Possible
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: During our study about innovation, we find the topic of adjacent possible. Innovation happens but not many people can point out clearly.

item.title: Delegation And Believe It Will Work
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We can’t always make things (or everything) on our own. If that somehow truly happens, then Inc, Corp, Enterprise or Group won’t stand a chance with Freelancers.

item.title: Constructive Feedback
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It’s in human nature to instantly lose their mind when things get hard, and somehow they split nasty things that can’t be undone.

item.title: 2019 In Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Another year has gone by. And we just celebrated the 5th year that we survived all the challenges. Everyone was facing their own, but I have seen many of you reaching new stages and achieve new targets.

item.title: Delegate Work Not Responsibility
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We can bring in all the technology in the world, but if we can’t delegate properly, our companies have no chance of scaling well.

item.title: Benefits & perks
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Since most Dwarves Foundation employees work in Saigon, this section is written with that as the default. Some benefits don’t make sense in other countries.

item.title: Where we work
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Office The Dwarves HQ is in Saigon, Vietnam. Fifty-ish people and two cats have desk space in the Saigon office, but those people also work from home regularly.

item.title: 2018 In Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: 2018 was the memorable year with lots of achievements. We adapted the new team structure. We defined things we value and live that culture tediously.

item.title: Make Remote Working Works
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Being office-present keeps you effective. Firms lean on that. It explains why companies are down to invest a fortune on building creative office with other benefit packages.
